p: In this context, it is necessary to consider Citrus Bacterial Canker (CBC), a potentially dangerous phytopathy for the Mediterranean Basin, caused by two similar but taxonomically distinct bacteria: Xanthomonas citri pv. citri (synonym X. citri subsp. citri) and X. citri pv. aurantifolii (synonym X. fuscans subsp. aurantifolii). As specified in other studies, “ X. citri” is used to refer to any citrus fruit canker (hyperplasia) produced by Xanthomonas, whether Asian ( X. citri pv. citri) or South American ( X. citri pv. aurantifolii) groups [ 18, 19, 20, 21, 22].
